originalText.text: Wouldn't recommend that agency for any parents seeking helping with their special needs child , Hannah the manager will always change case coordinators handling your case because she doesn't keep them more than 3 months or so and all what you will get from that agency is only when they call you asking for the monthly visit as it is mandatory by Medicaid and that is it ( no services ,other support or help will be provided at all ).

originalText.text: Don‚Äôt let the first impressions of this center fool you. It might not be new and glamorous, but the people that work at Hand in Hand are special kind of people. They care about the kids so much! They are so excited to greet the children every morning when the kids arrive, and they get them from the bus with smiles and hugs. Both classroom teachers work wonders (huge shout-out to Edyta and Donna!) Samantha the speech therapist and Emily OT are so experienced, warm and kind. My son looks forward to going to school every day. Thank you Olya and the rest of the girls for taking such good care of him! Thank you Chana for creating this wonderful community, a home away from home, for our kids that need special care and instruction. You truly changed our family‚Äôs life, and for that I‚Äôll be forever grateful! Any parents considering Hand in Hand for your children - do not hesitate! This will be the best decision that you will do for your family.

originalText.text:
My son started in Hand in Hand two months ago and I see big progress in him already. Unlike other places, he didn‚Äôt cry and cling to me the second day during drop off. He‚Äôs very happy with those therapy technicians who are energetic, sweet and warm.
The biggest progress he makes is Speech. He started to talk two weeks after we started here. I figured out One on one attention is very important and that‚Äôs why the children got in here

originalText.text: As a parent having a child who just graduated from HIH I don‚Äôt think I can thank them enough for the progress my child has made in just a year. He went from being non verbal to being able to ask for what he wants, he has such a large vocabulary now, he‚Äôs able to make better eye contact, sit through story time and many other things They have been so helpful starting with his TA‚Äôs Michelle, Leencey, and Jennifer who always made him feel comfortable. All of his therapists, and the entire staff who made this journey easy and stress free.

originalText.text: Been a parent with 2 special needs kids. I put both of them in HIH within different years apart and they really tremendous help me out for both of kids. I really recommend this place because it will help you child in different levels to archive from socializing with other kids, feeding techniques, sensory issues, SPL (speech therapy), Occupational therapist and so many other services.   I THANKS üôèüèª the Staffs and and all the members of the help, communication and services what they done for both of my kids. This is a Great Place for Early Intervention Services.
